page.title: 08TRANSPORT
page.content: There is little through traffic, except on the B5O63 and there are no scheduled bus services. Most families have their own cars; youths have motor cycles and children, as well as adults, have cycles. Children of school age are transported by special bus to their schools in the nearby towns and villages. Voluntary Car Schemes operate by which people without their own cars can make essential journeys, contributing roughly the cost of an equivalent bus fare. Generally, people are more mobile than town dwellers. Roads other than the B5O63 are narrow lanes, mainly used by farm vehicles, private cars and occasionally heavy farm equipment, such as combine harvesters.
